characters.name: Ace
characters.description: A member of Captain Celaeno's pirate crew in My Little Pony: The Movie Prequel Issue #2. Named the same as a G1 Earth pony boy and shares this name with Ace Point.

characters.name: Captain Blister
characters.description: In The Official Movie Sourcebook.â€‹[â€‹specifyâ€‹]â€‹

characters.name: Boyle
characters.description: The burly member of Captain Celaeno's pirate crew in My Little Pony The Movie, My Little Pony: The Movie Prequel Issue #2, Beyond Equestria: Rainbow Dash Rights the Ship, and Gameloft's mobile game. Has a false right hand. Has a toy in the Guardians of Harmony toy line with several hand attachments. Card #20 C in the Seaquestria & Beyond expansion set of Enterplay's collectible card game gives Boyle the description "Boyle doesn't let a little thing like "losing his hand" get in the way of his weightlifting regimen." His mobile game description states, "We sure hope that Celaeno's crewbird's a lefty -- or that he's got a 'grabber' attachment for that arm cannon." Voiced by Max Martini.

characters.name: Brutus
characters.description: A member of Captain Celaeno's pirate crew in My Little Pony: The Movie Prequel Issue #2.

characters.name: Captain Celaeno
characters.description: Captain Celaeno (/səˈlɑːnoʊ/ suh-LAH-noh) is a female anthropomorphic parrot who appears as a supporting character in My Little Pony The Movie and a central character in the chapter book Beyond Equestria: Rainbow Dash Rights the Ship. She is the captain of a crew of pirates that sails the Sea of Clouds beyond Equestria.

characters.name: Lix Spittle
characters.description: The female member of Captain Celaeno's pirate crew in My Little Pony The Movie, My Little Pony: The Movie Prequel Issue #2, Beyond Equestria: Rainbow Dash Rights the Ship, and Gameloft's mobile game. Her in-game description states, "The chief cook on Captain Celaeno's airship. Today's special: gruel with gruel sauce!" Has a false tail tip. Voiced by Nicole Oliver.

characters.name: Marco
characters.description: A member of Captain Celaeno's crew of sky pirates in My Little Pony: The Movie Prequel Issue #2.

characters.name: Mullet
characters.description: The eyepatch-wearing first mate of Captain Celaeno's pirate crew in My Little Pony The Movie, My Little Pony: The Movie Prequel Issues #1 and #2, Beyond Equestria: Rainbow Dash Rights the Ship, and Gameloft's mobile game. His in-game description states, "Every air pirate captain's in need of a mate -- and as officers go, Mullet's simply first-rate!" Named "Grin" in The Art of My Little Pony: The Movie and Pony Pirate Party! Voiced by Mark Oliver.

characters.name: Pinwheel
characters.description: A member of Captain Celaeno's pirate crew in My Little Pony: The Movie Prequel Issue #2. Named the same as a G1 unicorn mare.

characters.name: Captain Rosella
characters.description: In The Official Movie Sourcebook.â€‹[â€‹specifyâ€‹]â€‹

characters.name: Squabble
characters.description: The wall-eyed member of Captain Celaeno's pirate crew in My Little Pony The Movie, My Little Pony: The Movie Prequel Issue #2, Beyond Equestria: Rainbow Dash Rights the Ship, and Gameloft's mobile game. His in-game description states, "SQWAK!" Has a false beak. Named "Murdock" in The Art of My Little Pony: The Movie as a placeholder. Only speaks in squawks.

characters.name: Castor
characters.description: One of Princess Luna's pet owls in Princess Luna and the Festival of the Winter Moon.

characters.name: Constance
characters.description: Constance is a background bird and one of Fluttershy's animal companions. She first appears in Friendship is Magic, part 1, and she is named in the season six episode Flutter Brutter.

characters.name: Denise
characters.description: An unnamed stallion's pet goose who goes missing in Daring Do and the Marked Thief of Marapore.

characters.name: Firebrand
characters.description: Penumbra Quill's pet Phoenix. Shares his name with a female unicorn.

characters.name: Henrita
characters.description: One of Fluttershy's chickens. Mentioned in Fluttershy and the Fine Furry Friends Fair.

characters.name: Judy
characters.description: One of Fluttershy's birds. Mentioned in Fluttershy and the Fine Furry Friends Fair.

characters.name: Owlowiscious
characters.description: Owlowiscious ( /aʊləˈwɪʃəs/ ow-luh-WISH-us) is an owl who first appears in the season one episode Owl's Well That Ends Well and is adopted by Twilight Sparkle as her pet. He initially raises Spike's suspicions but eventually helps Twilight in rescuing Spike from another dragon. He appears again in multiple episodes throughout the series.

characters.name: Peewee
characters.description: Peewee is a male phoenix and Spike's former pet, adopted by him in the season two episode Dragon Quest.

characters.name: Philomena
characters.description: Philomena is Princess Celestia's pet phoenix, residing in Canterlot and introduced in A Bird in the Hoof.

characters.name: Philomena
characters.description: An alternate universe version of Philomena that appears in Friendship is Magic Issue #19.

characters.name: Pollux
characters.description: One of Princess Luna's pet owls in Princess Luna and the Festival of the Winter Moon.

characters.name: Putt-Putt
characters.description: A homing pigeon in Beyond Equestria: Rainbow Dash Rights the Ship that Rainbow Dash uses to send a message to Captain Celaeno, who claims the pigeon is a former member of her crew.

characters.name: Avery
characters.description: A background bird: appears in Friendship is Magic, part 1 and elsewhere;â€‹[â€‹specifyâ€‹]â€‹ Equestrian version named Avery and referred to both as female and as male in My Little Pony: Friends Forever Issue #21, human world version named Hubertâ€”the same as a Butterdragon and as a swanâ€”in A Little Birdie Told Me.

characters.name: Calvin
characters.description: An animal companion of Blackthorn's. Named the same as a chipmunk.

characters.name: Edgar
characters.description: One of Fluttershy's sanctuary animals on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #64 page 16. Named after Edgar Allan Poe.

characters.name: Elizabeak
characters.description: Counterparts to both wild and domestic animals are featured throughout Equestria in various episodes. Most of these animals only have incidental roles or appearances. The level of intelligence these animals show can vary, even between members of the same species. Some animals, much like ponies, are also capable of speech or social interaction. In the My Little Pony Friendship Is Magic Season 1 DVD's commentary for Winter Wrap Up, executive Robert Fewkes said "the rule is only the hoofed creatures" can speak in the show (not counting mythological creatures).

characters.name: Eloise and Hubert
characters.description: Swan design used in Between Dark and Dawn (multiple; one referred to as male) and The Last Problem (two; each named). Hubert is named the same as a Butterdragon and as Avery's human world version.

characters.name: Hummingway
characters.description: Counterparts to both wild and domestic animals are featured throughout Equestria in various episodes. Most of these animals only have incidental roles or appearances. The level of intelligence these animals show can vary, even between members of the same species. Some animals, much like ponies, are also capable of speech or social interaction. In the My Little Pony Friendship Is Magic Season 1 DVD's commentary for Winter Wrap Up, executive Robert Fewkes said "the rule is only the hoofed creatures" can speak in the show (not counting mythological creatures).

characters.name: Josephine
characters.description: Dove design used in The Last Problem (multiple; one named).

characters.name: Reginald
characters.description: A background bird: appears in Friendship is Magic, part 1 and elsewhere;â€‹[â€‹specifyâ€‹]â€‹ named via human world version in A Little Birdie Told Me.

characters.name: Mr. Robin
characters.description: A robin for whom Rarity creates a large birdhouse in Inspiration Manifestation.

characters.name: Tina
characters.description: A blue bird that interacts with Spike in Friendship is Magic Issue #28 page 13 panel 2.

characters.name: S02E21 Unnamed Phoenix Father
characters.description: Peewee's father in Dragon Quest, Just for Sidekicks, and Molt Down. Also mentioned on My Little Pony Micro-Series Issue #9 page 2.

characters.name: S02E21 Unnamed Phoenix Mother
characters.description: Peewee's mother in Dragon Quest, Just for Sidekicks, and Molt Down. Also mentioned on My Little Pony Micro-Series Issue #9 page 2.

characters.name: S04E14 Unnamed Parrot
characters.description: One of the animals offered for adoption during Fluttershy's animal shelter fundraiser in Filli Vanilli. Also appears in Trade Ya!, Castle Sweet Castle, MLPEG Friendship Games _Bloopers_, and Fluttershy Leans In.

characters.name: 33852 Unnamed Parrot
characters.description: A parrot friend toy packaged with Playful Pony Feathermay in 2011.
